workflow.name: Domain-specific web content crawler with depth control & text extraction
workflow.description:
This template implements a recursive web crawler inside n8n. Starting from a given URL, it crawls linked pages up to a maximum depth (default: 3), extracts text and links, and returns the collected content via webhook.

---

## üöÄ How It Works

1) **Webhook Trigger**  
   Accepts a JSON body with a `url` field.  
   Example payload:
    
    { "url": "https://example.com" }

2) **Initialization**  
   - Sets crawl parameters: `url`, `domain`, `maxDepth = 3`, and `depth = 0`.  
   - Initializes global static data (`pending`, `visited`, `queued`, `pages`).

3) **Recursive Crawling**  
   - Fetches each page (HTTP Request).  
   - Extracts body text and links (HTML node).  
   - Cleans and deduplicates links.  
   - Filters out:
     - External domains (only same-site is followed)  
     - Anchors (#), mailto/tel/javascript links  
     - Non-HTML files (.pdf, .docx, .xlsx, .pptx)

4) **Depth Control & Queue**  
   - Tracks visited URLs  
   - Stops at `maxDepth` to prevent infinite loops  
   - Uses SplitInBatches to loop the queue

5) **Data Collection**  
   - Saves each crawled page (`url`, `depth`, `content`) into `pages[]`  
   - When `pending = 0`, combines results

6) **Output**  
   - Responds via the Webhook node with:
     - `combinedContent` (all pages concatenated)
     - `pages[]` (array of individual results)
   - Large results are chunked when exceeding ~12,000 characters

---

## üõ†Ô∏è Setup Instructions

1) **Import Template**  
   Load from n8n Community Templates.

2) **Configure Webhook**  
   - Open the **Webhook** node  
   - Copy the Test URL (development) or Production URL (after deploy)  
   - You‚Äôll POST crawl requests to this endpoint

3) **Run a Test**  
   Send a POST with JSON:

    curl -X POST https://<your-n8n>/webhook/<id> \
      -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
      -d '{"url": "https://example.com"}'

4) **View Response**  
   The crawler returns a JSON object containing `combinedContent` and `pages[]`.

---

## ‚öôÔ∏è Configuration

- **maxDepth**  
  Default: 3. Adjust in the **Init Crawl Params** (Set) node.

- **Timeouts**  
  HTTP Request node timeout is 5 seconds per request; increase if needed.

- **Filtering Rules**  
  - Only same-domain links are followed (apex and `www` treated as same-site)  
  - Skips anchors, `mailto:`, `tel:`, `javascript:`  
  - Skips document links (.pdf, .docx, .xlsx, .pptx)  
  - You can tweak the regex and logic in **Queue & Dedup Links** (Code) node

---

## üìå Limitations

- No JavaScript rendering (static HTML only)  
- No authentication/cookies/session handling  
- Large sites can be slow or hit timeouts; chunking mitigates response size

---

## ‚úÖ Example Use Cases

- Extract text across your site for AI ingestion / embeddings  
- SEO/content audit and internal link checks  
- Build a lightweight page corpus for downstream processing in n8n

---

## ‚è±Ô∏è Estimated Setup Time

~10 minutes (import ‚Üí set webhook ‚Üí test request)

parameters.content:
# n8n Workflow Explanation: Web Crawler

This workflow implements a web crawler in n8n that scrapes website pages starting from a given URL, up to a maximum depth of 3. It fetches HTML content, extracts links and body text, deduplicates URLs, limits crawling to the same domain, excludes non-HTML files like PDFs, and collects page data for output via webhook.

## Key Features
- **Depth-Limited Crawling**: Stops at maxDepth to prevent infinite loops.
- **Deduplication**: Tracks visited and queued URLs using global static data to avoid re-fetching.
- **Same-Site Only**: Only follows links within the initial domain (apex or www variants).
- **Link Filtering**: Ignores mailto, tel, javascript, anchors (#), and file types like PDF, DOCX, etc.
- **State Management**: Uses n8n's static data for pending count, visited list, queued dict, and accumulated pages across iterations.
- **Batching and Chunking**: Processes links in batches; chunks collected content by character limits for efficient output.
- **Error Handling**: Nodes like Fetch HTML and Queue & Dedup have onError: continueRegularOutput to skip failures.
- **Output**: Combines all page contents (URL, depth, text) into a single string, optionally appending extra JSON, and responds via webhook.

## Step-by-Step Detailed Breakdown

1. **Webhook**: Entry point. Receives JSON payload with 'url' key. Triggers on POST to specific path.

2. **Init Crawl Params (Set Node)**: Processes input. Sets 'url' and 'domain' from body.url, maxDepth=3, depth=0. Keeps only these fields.

3. **Init Globals (Code Node)**: Initializes global static data: pending=1, visited=[], queued={}, pages=[]. Normalizes domain from URL, handling malformed cases without URL().

4. **Seed Root Crawl Item (Merge Node)**: Combines initial params with globals output. Mode: combine by position, prefer last on clashes, include unpaired.

5. **Fetch HTML Page (HTTP Request Node)**: GETs the current URL. Timeout 5s, continues on error. Outputs raw HTML body.

6. **Attach URL/Depth to HTML (Code Node)**: Attaches url and depth from seed to the HTML response item.

7. **Extract Body & Links (HTML Node)**: Operation: extractHtmlContent. Gets 'content' from body selector (trimmed, cleaned), 'links' as array of href attributes from a[href].

8. **Queue & Dedup Links (Code Node)**: Core logic. Normalizes URLs (absolute, no trailing /). Extracts hosts ignoring www/protocol/path. Marks current as visited, dequeues it. Filters links: same-site, unvisited, not queued, depth < max. Queues new links with depth+1. Decrements pending, adds new to pending. Outputs new link items + current page item with content.

9. **IF Crawl Depth OK? (IF Node)**: Checks if type='link' and depth <= maxDepth. True: requeue for fetch. False: store page.

10. **Requeue Link Item (Code Node)**: Removes 'type', returns item for looping back to fetch.

11. **Loop Links (Batches) (SplitInBatches Node)**: Batch size 1, no reset. Loops through queued links one by one, feeding back to Seed Root Crawl Item for next fetch.

12. **Store Page Data (Set Node)**: Keeps url, content, depth from page item.

13. **Collect Pages & Emit When Done (Code Node)**: Appends page to global pages[]. If pending <=0, emits combined content string (URL/depth/content per page, separated). Else, empty output.

14. **Merge Web Pages (Merge Node)**: Combines collected pages from loop with initial globals (for extras?).

15. **Combine & Chunk (Code Node)**: Merges stored/incoming pages, normalizes. Appends extra JSON if present. Builds full combinedContent. Chunks pages by max chars (12000) then subgroups of 5. Outputs batch items with index, pages subset, full combinedContent, accId.

16. **Respond to Webhook (RespondToWebhook Node)**: Sends the chunked output as response.

## Additional Notes
- **Loop Mechanism**: Uses SplitInBatches to iterate queue, feeding back to merge for recursive crawling.
- **Termination**: Pending counter ensures emission only when all pages processed (no more queue).
- **Limitations**: No external domains, basic link cleaning, assumes HTTP/HTTPS, no auth/cookies.
- **Usage**: Trigger via webhook with {"url": "https://example.com"}. Output: JSON with batched page data.

nodes.name: Loop Links (Batches)
nodes.notes: Iterates through the queue of links to be crawled one at a time.

nodes.name: IF Crawl Depth OK?
nodes.notes: Validates whether the current depth is below the maximum depth allowed.

nodes.name: Extract Body & Links
nodes.notes: Parses HTML content and extracts body text and anchor href links.

nodes.name: Fetch HTML Page
nodes.notes: Makes HTTP request to fetch the content of the current URL.

nodes.name: Store Page Data
nodes.notes: Captures the URL, page content, and depth for storage or export.

nodes.name: Init Globals
nodes.notes: Initializes the pending count in static data for crawl completion tracking.

nodes.name: Init Crawl Params
nodes.notes: Defines the root URL, domain name, and max crawl depth.

nodes.name: Requeue Link Item
nodes.notes: Removes internal 'type' field and re-enqueues the link for next crawl.

nodes.name: Queue & Dedup Links
nodes.notes: Cleans and deduplicates links. Tracks visited URLs. Prepares next crawl queue.

user.name: Le Nguyen
user.bio: Salesforce Architect with 10+ years of experience in CRM, integrations, and automation. Skilled in Apex, LWC, REST APIs, and full-stack dev (JavaScript, .NET). I build secure, scalable workflows in n8n‚Äîconnecting Salesforce, Stripe, and more. Passionate about lead scoring, data sync, and secure field masking. Certified Application Architect with deep expertise in platform, integration, and data architecture.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.

data.details: The Code node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow.
